page.title: 03MALVERN SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: Malvern Sewage Works processes about two million gallons of sewage each day.It is gravity fed from the Eastern slopes of the{Malvern Hills.}During rain storms water from road drains can increase the flow to over six million gallons and overflow systems automatically divert storm water, untreated , into the{Pool Brook.}The process of cleaning sewage begins with the removal by{screens}of large, hard objects such as bricks and pieces of wood which could damage machinery. Rags and paper are passed through a {communuter}and the shredded and squeezed residue is automatically dropped into sacks for removal.Road grit is also removed at this stage. Finer solids settle at the bottom of {sedimentation tanks.}This{'sludge', rich in nitrogen , is pumped into {sludge tanks}to be fed through presses
